The Food Security Bill: Is it a boon or bane for Indian Economy? Do you think the Bill can help protect people against poverty and insecurity?

The food security bill:

It plays a vital role in the Indian economy because very individual need to develop there life style and needs they want, and the government should take care of rural areas which are underdeveloped areas in the country and they should give equal responsible to every citizens that can helps the GDP growth.

India is a developing country, the Indian economy mostly depends upon the agricultural facilities that may helps a lot to the country for developing, as we can say that food security bill is the bane for the Indian Economy because without that the poverty and GDP will get down the economy, to maintain it standard the government should concentrate of the agriculture sectors as well as manufacturing of seeds and pesticides because if we produce the good quality of seeds to grow the crops in the agriculture, the crops will grows rapidly and that give a good result to the farmers and to the Indian economy this maintains standard growth in the our country.

Even the farmer should be educated and their children's and all other people who are sending their children's  to work in such organization like industries, hotels, construction of building etc. They should stop sending the child and send them to the school and colleges educated them well that represents the good result to the economy development as well as to the poverty line in the country.

The Indian government should mostly concentrate on the backward region because if we compare to backward region and developed region their will a lot of differences will occur and that causes lower poverty and less revenue in the country that effects the GDP and the Indian Economy.

That is food security bill is boon to the Indian economy and the bill helps in protect people against from poverty and insecurity.
